Key Arguments: The legislation would allow the government to define and enforce 'truth', which is seen as inappropriate.
It is viewed as a limitation on freedom of speech and an attack on human rights.
The legislation is described as Orwellian, Draconian, tyrannical, and authoritarian.
It is believed that the legislation will shut down privacy and marginalize citizens.
There is concern that it will create fear and hinder communication between people.
The legislation is seen as a threat to free, critical, and progressive thinking.
It is perceived as a 'nanny state' measure that fails to address real issues and perpetrators.
Notable Quotes: Adoption of this legislation could see the Government define what truth is.
Limiting the freedom of speech is an attack on the human rights of the citizens.
It simply can be qualified as an Orwellian crusade, Draconian, tyrannical and authoritarian.
The value of free, critical and progressive thinking will be crushed.
